keyMoments.title: Crew Regroups After Shadow Loss
keyMoments.description: The crew reunites aboard the Thousand Sunny to discover that Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji have lost their shadows to Gecko Moria.
keyMoments.significance: This moment brings the crew together to share information and strategize about how to retrieve their shadows and rescue Nami.

keyMoments.title: Connection to Laboon Revealed
keyMoments.description: The crew discovers their shared connection to Laboon, with some members having met the whale at the start of their Grand Line journey.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation strengthens the crew's emotional investment in helping Brook and demonstrates the interconnected nature of their journey.

keyMoments.title: Determination to Help Brook
keyMoments.description: After learning about Brook's promise to Laboon, the crew becomes more determined to help Brook retrieve his shadow and eventually join their crew.
keyMoments.significance: This sets up Brook's eventual recruitment and shows how the crew is motivated by personal connections and promises.

formationStory: Luffy began forming his crew after leaving his home village of Fushia, gradually recruiting members as he sailed through the East Blue and into the Grand Line.
jollyRoger: A skull wearing a straw hat with crossed bones behind it

captain: Yorki (original), Brook (acting captain after Yorki's departure)

keyMoments.title: Promise to Laboon Revealed
keyMoments.description: The Rumbar Pirates' promise to return to Laboon at Reverse Mountain after sailing around the Grand Line is revealed as Brook's primary motivation for living.
keyMoments.significance: This backstory provides the emotional core of Brook's character and explains why he has endured fifty years of solitude.

formationStory: A pirate crew that sailed the seas decades before the current timeline. They befriended the baby whale Laboon and traveled with him until they had to leave him at Reverse Mountain at the entrance to the Grand Line.
historicalSignificance: The Rumbar Pirates were known for being a musical crew that spread joy and music wherever they went. They were wiped out by disease and enemy attacks, with Brook being the only survivor due to his Yomi Yomi no Mi Devil Fruit powers.
